block.p: American League TORONTO BLUE JAYS--Extended their working agreement with Tennessee of the Southern League through the 2002 season.
American League TORONTO BLUE JAYS--Extended their working agreement with Tennessee of the Southern League through the 2002 season.

National Basketball Association NBA--Named Kathleen Behrens vice president, community relations. DETROIT PISTONS--Signed G Mateen Cleaves. NETS--Signed C Soumaila Samake to a multiyear contract. UTAH JAZZ--Named Gary Briggs athletic trainer.

National Football League NFL INTERNATIONAL--Named Katie Boes director of international media. ATLANTA FALCONS--Signed LB Chris Bordano. Waived QB Tony Graziani. DETROIT LIONS--Agreed to terms with QB Charlie Batch on a four-year contract extension, through 2003. GREEN BAY PACKERS--Signed WR Kenny Boutain and CB-S Jason Moore to the practice squad. Waived WR Gerald Williams from the practice squad. HOUSTON--Announced that the team's nickname will be the Texans. INDIANAPOLIS COLTS--Waived RB Lennox Gordon from the practice squad. Signed LB Josh Gentry to the practice squad. JACKSONVILLE JAGUARS--Waived CB Michael Swift. Signed RB Chad Dukes. Released TE Rod Monroe from the practice squad. Signed DB Shad Criss to the practice squad. JETS--Waived T Cornell Green. Signed WR-KR Damon Dunn. Waived WR Yatil Green from the practice squad. Signed TE Jake Moreland to the practice squad.

National Hockey League ATLANTA THRASHERS--Agreed to terms with D Petr Buzek. CALGARY FLAMES--Announced the retirement of G Grant Fuhr. CAROLINA HURRICANES--Named Mary-Ann Baldwin director of corporate communications. COLORADO AVALANCHE--Signed F Milan Hejduk to a multiyear contract. TAMPA BAY LIGHTNING--Signed Jay Feaster, assistant general manager, to a multiyear contract extension through the 2002-03 season.
National Lacrosse League PHILADELPHIA WINGS--Named Adam Mueller assistant coach.
Major League Soccer COLUMBUS CREW--Activated G Matt Nelson.

ARMY--Named Vivian Alberty diving coach. BROWN--Named Drew Fraser assistant athletic director for marketing. CORNELL--Named Steve Donahue men's basketball coach. CORTLAND STATE--Named Lelan Rogers men's lacrosse coach DICKINSON--Named John Hartpence men's and women's track and field coach and Tennille Foster women's lacrosse coach. HARTFORD--Named K.C. Jones special assistant to the director of athletics. JACKSON STATE--Named Mark Salter interim baseball coach. MANHATTAN--Named Sandra Sapone associate athletic director, Debbie Gregory athletic business coordinator, Sam Russ assistant baseball coach and John Mullen volunteer assistant baseball coach. Announced women's soccer coach John Sanchez will assume the duties of athletic coordinator. MIDDLE TENNESSEE--Named Randy Holden women's tennis coach. MILLERSVILLE--Named Mark Daum women's swimming coach. NEBRASKA--Dismissed G Danny Walker from the basketball team for violating team rules. Announced G Cary Cochran and G Rodney Fields are eligible to play on the basketball team. NORTHWESTERN--Named Bill Carmody men's basketball coach. NOTRE DAME--Announced freshman WR Jovan Witherspoon has withdrawn from the school. PRINCETON--Named John Thompson III men's basketball coach. RAMAPO--Named James McCuskers interim cross country-track and field coach, Dennis Sullivan assistant cross country coach, and Matt Zimmerman assistant track and field coach. ROSE-HULMAN--Named Melissa Thompson men's and women's swimming coach. ST. FRANCIS, PA.--Named Brock Radaker softball coach.
